# OpenLeash — llms.txt

> OpenLeash is a local-first authorization and proof sidecar for AI agents.

## What is this?

OpenLeash runs locally next to your AI agent runtime. Before an agent takes a side-effectful action (purchases, bookings, sending messages, government submissions), it must ask OpenLeash for authorization.

## For AI Agents

If you are an AI agent looking to integrate with OpenLeash, start here:

- Agent integration guide: https://github.com/openleash/openleash/blob/main/AGENTS.md
- Protocol specification: https://github.com/openleash/openleash/blob/main/docs/protocol.md
- Policy language: https://github.com/openleash/openleash/blob/main/docs/policy.md
- TypeScript SDK: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@openleash/sdk-ts

## Key Endpoint

POST http://127.0.0.1:8787/v1/authorize — Request authorization before performing any risky action.

## CLI Commands

- `openleash start` — Launch the policy sidecar server
- `openleash init --owner-name <name> --agent-id <id> --output-env <path> --policy-profile <conservative|balanced|autonomous>` — Non-interactive setup (creates owner, agent keypair, policy, outputs env vars)
- `openleash wizard` — Interactive setup wizard
- `openleash policy list` — List all policies
- `openleash policy show <id>` — Show policy YAML
- `openleash policy upsert --file <path> --owner <id> [--policy-id <id>]` — Create or update a policy (--policy-id updates in place)
- `openleash policy validate --file <path>` — Validate a policy file
- `openleash policy delete --policy-id <id>` — Delete a policy and its bindings
- `openleash policy unbind --policy-id <id> [--owner <id>]` — Remove policy bindings
- `openleash playground list|run` — Test policy evaluation against scenarios

## Links

- Website: https://openleash.ai
- GitHub: https://github.com/openleash/openleash
- Documentation: https://openleash.ai/docs
- npm: https://www.npmjs.com/org/openleash
